content: this pattern creates a beanie with a snuggly fitting double brim and flappy ears to keep a baby s head warm it uses stranded knitting to add some interest to the bottom part of the hat without being overwhelming it gives instructions on how to make the hat but doesn t go into details on how to make the cords and pompom that are added as finishings **needles** us sizes 4 / 6 metric sizes 3 5 and 4mm preferably short interchangeable needles & 16in cord **gauge** 20st / 32 row with bigger needles in stockinette stitch **yarn** cloudborn fibers superwash merino worsted twist 45/50/50/55g in main color mc 5g in contrast color 1 cc1 and 5g in contrast color 2 or whatever fits the gauge a wool mix yarn tends to hold the pattern better than cotton **sizes** 3 months 6 months 9 months 1 year the fit is supposed to be snug
